summary:
Samhain is an ancient Gaelic festival celebrated on November 1st, marking the end of summer and the start of winter. It is believed to have Celtic roots and is associated with the supernatural and the spirit world. People lit bonfires, offered food to spirits, and dressed up in costumes to mimic and protect themselves from these spirits.

This festival was an important time for the community, with feasts and gatherings. It also involved divination rituals, often using food like apples and nuts. Over time, Samhain's traditions influenced modern Halloween celebrations. Today, it is still observed by some as a religious holiday.
title: Samhain
